content.prompt: In the period after the First World War, the British economist John Maynard Keynes argued that

choices.label: price inflation was the primary threat to economic growth
military spending should remain high even in peacetime
governments should respond to economic downturns by increasing spending
the best ideas of Adam Smith and Karl Marx could be reconciled
government interference with the market created economic inefficiencies
